label: 橡
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 55th  . Nara National Museum . 2003
説明文: A dye close to black, which is produced from the acorns or bark of the sawtooth oak (Quercus acutissima Carrutherus) mordanted with iron. In the Nara period, the color tsurubami refered to the black tints rendered with this acorn dye; the same dyestuff mordanted with ash lye was called yellow tsurubami.
